intro: Capnoides ramosa, commonly known as the branched capnoid, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are often clustered in the axils of the leaves. Capnoides ramosa is typically found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth.
